p: Introductions: In view the adverse consequence of post-operative atrial fibrillation (POAF) encompassing hemodynamic deterioration, thromboembolic hazards beside the intolerable fast rate, and mortality; preventing POAF seems to be an ideal goal. The POAF events incidence reported to be 30 and 40Â % in coronary artery bypass and valvular surgeries respectively. [1, 2]. We aim to assess the impact of a simple clinical practice guideline for POAF events prevention and highlighting the incidence in Asian population.
